curam.util.connectors.mqseries

Class MQStructMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.connectors.mqseries.MQStructMapper

  • public class MQStructMapper
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides functionality for mapping struct classes to/from MQ Series messages. Each attribute of the struct is converted to a string (usually fixed-length) and the message consists of all these strings concatenated together.

    The infrastructure provides default conversions for all of the Curam fundamental data types E.g. Date is converted to a string of the form `ddmmyyyy`, but for any field of a message it is possible for the developer to specify a customized conversion class (i.e. a subclass of MQFieldMapper) which can encode/decode the data into/from a string of any format, including variable length fields.

    This class is intended to be used by code produced by the Curam SDEJ generators but can also be used by handcrafted code.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MQStructMapper

        public MQStructMapper(java.lang.Class<?> type,
                      MQFieldMetadata[] fieldsMetadata)
               throws AppRuntimeException
        Constructs an MQSeries converter given the struct type and an array of MQFieldMetadata containing conversion information about each field of the struct.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the struct to be converted.
        fieldsMetadata - An array of MQFieldMetadata objects containing one entry for each field of the struct
        Throws:
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_NO_MAPPING_AVAILABLE_FOR_DATATYPE - if no mapping is available for the data type of the field.
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_CUSTOM_QUEUE_MAPPER_CLASS_NOT_FOUND - if the specified mapper class could not be found.
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_EXCEPTION_CREATING_QUEUE_MAPPER_CLASS - if the specified mapper class could not be instantiated.

      • MQStructMapper

        public MQStructMapper(java.lang.Class<?> type,
                      MQFieldMetadata[] fieldsMetadata,
                      java.lang.String structContext)
               throws AppRuntimeException
        Constructs an MQSeries converter given the struct type, an array of MQFieldMetadata containing conversion information about each field of the struct, and context information about the struct.

        This version will do default conversion on each field of the given type of struct but the structContext information provides for looking up the names of custom field mapper classes for the fields in the struct in the ResourceBundle QueueConnectorFieldMappers.properties .

        Parameters:
        type - The type of the struct to be converted.
        fieldsMetadata - An array MQFieldMetadata for the fields of the struct
        structContext - The context in which this struct is being used - that is, class name, operation name and parameter name. For example: "Person.read.key". This is to enable the developer to associate a conversion with a field of a struct in a specific operation.
        Throws:
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_NO_MAPPING_AVAILABLE_FOR_DATATYPE - if no mapping is available for the data type of the field.
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_CUSTOM_QUEUE_MAPPER_CLASS_NOT_FOUND - if the specified mapper class could not be found.
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_EXCEPTION_CREATING_QUEUE_MAPPER_CLASS - if the specified mapper class could not be instantiated.

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static MQStructMapper newInstance(java.lang.Class<?> type,
                                         MQFieldMetadata[] fieldsMetadata,
                                         java.lang.String structContext)
        Creates an instance of the MQStructMapper class for one struct, given the type of the struct, an array of MQFieldMetadata objects for the struct fields, and context information about the struct.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the struct to be converted.
        fieldsMetadata - An array of MQFieldMetadata objects containing one entry for each field of the struct
        structContext - The context in which this struct is being used - that is, class name, operation name and parameter name. For example: "Person.read.key". This is to enable the developer to associate a conversion with a field of a struct in a specific operation.
        Returns:
        A new MQStructMapper object, or null if one couldn't be created - in which case a warning is written to the log.

      • encodeStruct

        public java.lang.String encodeStruct(java.lang.Object structObject)
                              throws AppRuntimeException
        Gets a string containing the encoded form of the struct.
        Parameters:
        structObject - The struct class to be encoded
        Returns:
        A String containing the encoded data.
        Throws:
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_EXCEPTION_ENCODING_FIELD - if a field of the struct could not be encoded.

      • decodeStruct

        public java.lang.Object decodeStruct(java.lang.String encodedData)
                              throws AppException
        Decodes a string and converts it into a struct.
        Parameters:
        encodedData - A string containing the encoded data
        Returns:
        A new instance of the struct populated with the data which has been decoded.
        Throws:
        AppException - ID_EXCEPTION_DECODING_QUEUE_MESSAGE - containing a linked exception if a field in the target struct cannot be accessed.
        AppException - ID_BADLY_ENCODED_MESSAGE - if the encoded data is empty or incorrectly formatted.
